alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 7:31AM CDT until June 03 at 12:08PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Missouri, including the following counties, Cass, Jackson, Johnson MO, Lafayette and Ray. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 731 AM CDT, the transportation department reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kansas City, Overland Park, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Blue Springs, Leawood, Raytown, Grandview, Belton, Raymore, Grain Valley, Harrisonville, Pleasant Hill, Oak Grove, Odessa, Greenwood, Peculiar, Buckner, Holden and Lake Lotawana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
